Class BusinessCard

      public int deposit​(double money)
      Calls the deposit method in the Actions class

      Specified by:
      deposit in class Card
      Parameters:
      money - the amount of money the user deposits
      Returns:
      Whatever the deposit action returns.

    • withdraw

      public int withdraw​(double money)
      Calls for the withdraw method in the Actions class.

      It also checks if the user has enough money and if the user hasn't gone past the spending limit

      Specified by:
      withdraw in class Card
      Parameters:
      money - the amount of money withdrawn
      Returns:
      Whatever the withdraw action returns, unless it encounters a problem (then it returns 1 or 2)

    • send_money

      public int send_money​(int user_id, double money)
      Calls the send_money method from the Actions class

      It also updates the spending limit and does the spending limit checks, returning an error if the user is over the spending limit.

      Overrides:
      send_money in class Card
      Parameters:
      user_id - integer type id of the user the money will be sent to
      money - amount of money that will be sent
      Returns:
      Whatever the send_money method returns, or 1/2 if an issue occurs

    • cwithdraw

      public int cwithdraw​(double money)
      Calls for the cwithdraw method in the Actions class.

      It also checks if the user has enough money and if the user hasn't gone past the spending limit

      Parameters:
      money - the amount of money withdrawn
      Returns:
      Whatever the cwithdraw action returns, unless it encounters a problem (then it returns 1 or 2)

    • cdeposit

      public int cdeposit​(double money)
      Similar to deposit but it's for company funds (it calls cdeposit from Actions)

      Parameters:
      money - the amount of money the user deposits
      Returns:
      Whatever the cdeposit action returns.

    • updateSpendingLimit

      public void updateSpendingLimit()
      Updates the card's spending limit

      The method takes the current date and compares it with the date the card has in the database's table. If the date is different, it updates it to today's date. If the date is equal to today's date, it updates the current spending limit in the database.

      Used to reset/check the user's spending limit for withdrawal actions.
